span.font: Please use the following phone number if you experience trouble connecting with our individual buildings: (563) 362-2985. The number will be monitored, and the messages will be sent to the correct personnel.

font.span: Please use the link provided for updates regarding the current school building closure and E-Learning:

font.b: Rockridge CUSD #300- Video recording of the April 14, 2020 Board of Education Meeting:
Rockridge CUSD #300- Video recording of the March 26, 2020 Special Board Meeting:

i.font: Rockridge School District, in an active partnership with parents and community, will promote excellence in a caring environment in which all students learn and grow. This partnership shall empower all students to develop a strong self-esteem and to become responsible learners and decision-makers. The School District is committed to developing and using a visionary and innovative curriculum and a knowledgeable and dedicated staff.

div.font: Parade & Pep Rally - Thursday, September 24th - 5:30 pm
FB Game vs. Fulton - Friday, September 25th - 7:00 pm
Homecoming Dance - Saturday, September 26th - 7:30 to 10:30 pm

span.span: Check out this great video from the Taylor Ridge & Illinois City Staff! We Miss Our Little Rockets!

div.span: The 2020 RHS Academic Awards program is still in need of donations. We WILL be awarding scholarships and awards to our students to honor their academic achievements! Please consider making a donation to help fund this program.

font.b: Rockridge: One Team One Family Shirts

div.span: In an effort to show our unification and support of each other during the COVID-19 pandemic, the Rockridge CUSD #300 District would like to make shirts available for purchase to the entire community. $5.00 from each item purchased will be given back to the school district, and the Rockridge School District will donate ALL proceeds back to local food pantries to assist during this difficult time. Online orders will run through April 23, 2020. Together, we will overcome this!!! Click this link to order online.

Due to our situation here is how we are going to handle the sale. We will take orders via email to Mr. Hyett (ahyett@rr300.org). Orders will be accepted any time after you receive this information. Please add your phone number.

font.span: There is a list of plants attached.

Some are still small but we can discuss that when you make your order.
They will be available next week. We will set up and communicate a pick up schedule once orders are placed, so there will space and the ability for social distancing. Once orders are in, orders will be put together and set out on tables in the parking lot.

div.span: All payments are on a donation basis. Take what you want and pay what you can.
Thank You for all of the years of support for the Rockridge FFA!!!!

font.b: HS Yearbook Order - Final Deadline April 30th

div.span: Time is running out to order the 2019-2020 Rockridge HS Yearbook! Orders must be placed by April 30th.

All orders are placed ONLINE at the Walsworth Yearbook site. Go to https://yearbookforever.com to place your order today! Additional options are available, such as Name Imprinted on the Cover ($7), Protective Plastic Cover ($4), and a Year In Review Insert ($4).
Please contact Yearbook Adviser Mrs. Haley MacDonald at 309-793-8020 or hmacdonald@rr300.org with any questions.
Click here for an updated version of the 2019-20 school calendar. Be sure to also consult the Google Calendar to the left of this page for the most up-to-date schedule information.

The Athletic Department Player-Parent meeting will now be an online video this year that must be watched by both athletes and parents. Individual sports player-parent meetings will still occur with the individual head coaches; however, the wholistic player-parent meeting video will just need to be watched at the onset of the first sport in which a student plays. The online video can be accessed at the following address:

span.font: Rockridge needs Sub Bus Drivers! We will provide the training to get you licensed. Click the link to learn more http://bit.ly/2lGfcqs. Contact Sarah Stropes at 309-795-1644 or sstropes@rr300.org for more information or to sign up!

b.font: The mission of Rockridge School District is to educate children. We believe that all children can learn, experience success, and pursue academic excellence. We seek to provide a safe and secure climate that fosters sound social, emotional, and physical development; self-discipline; critical thinking; creativity; and love of learning. We believe that these are the foundations necessary for students to become productive citizens in a democratic and ever-changing society.
